name: 5-tert-butyl-2-methyl-3-furoic acid
Reason: 5-tert-butyl-2-methyl-3-furoic acid has a melting point that can be predicted by considering its structural components. The basic unit for comparison is furan, which has a melting point of -10.0 degrees Celsius. The tert-butyl group (C(C)C) adds rigidity and molecular weight, estimated at +10. The methyl group (C) introduces a bulky side chain, raising the melting point due to steric hindrance and increasing the molecular volume, estimated at +5. The carbonyl group (C=O) creates a dipole, increasing intermolecular forces and melting point, estimated at +10. The furoic acid moiety introduces a rigid structure with potential hydrogen bonding, estimated at +20.
